title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for a statement describing a land use shown in Image 1.

Two points for explaining how one of the land uses shown in Image 1 relates to the cultural landscape.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways land-use patterns contribute to the cultural landscape:
The response correctly states one of the following ways land-use patterns contribute to the cultural landscape:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways land-use patterns contribute to the cultural landscape:

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for describing one way that local cultural practices may be affected by large-scale processes to produce new forms of cultural ideas.

Two points for describing two ways that local cultural practices may be affected by large-scale processes to produce new forms of cultural ideas.
descriptions: The response does not correctly describe one of the following ways that local cultural practices may be affected by large-scale processes to produce new forms of cultural ideas.
The response correctly describes one of the following ways that local cultural practices may be affected by large-scale processes to produce new forms of cultural ideas.
The response correctly describes two of the following ways that local cultural practices may be affected by large-scale processes to produce new forms of cultural ideas.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that the images do not indicate the degree of sovereignty in either of the locations shown, or for correctly describing the concept of sovereignty.

Two points for explaining how the concept of sovereignty relates to the cultural landscape and noting a limitation of the images.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following limitations of using the images to understand how sovereignty relates to the cultural landscape:
The response correctly states one of the following limitations of using the images to understand how sovereignty relates to the cultural landscape:
The response correctly explains one of the following limitations of using the images to understand how sovereignty relates to the cultural landscape:

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that use of English in both the United Kingdom and India has increased cultural convergence between the two countries.

Two points for explaining a specific example of how the use of the English language contributes to cultural convergence between the United Kingdom and India.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways how the use of the English language relates to cultural convergence between the United Kingdom and India:
The response correctly states the following way how the use of the English language relates to cultural convergence between the United Kingdom and India:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways how the use of the English language relates to cultural convergence between the United Kingdom and India:

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that differences within a country’s cultural landscape map act as devolutionary pressures.

Two points for explaining a specific example of how differences within a country’s cultural landscape may act as devolutionary pressures.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following degrees to which differences within a country’s cultural landscape may relate to the process of devolution.
The response correctly states the following degree to which differences within a country’s cultural landscape may relate to the process of devolution.
The response correctly explains one of the following degrees to which differences within a country’s cultural landscape may relate to the process of devolution:
